gurmukhi: ੲਿਤਿ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਬਚਿਤ੍ਰ ਨਾਟਕੇ ਰਾਮਵਤਾਰ ਅਤਕਾੲਿ ਬਧਹਿ ਧਿਅਾੲਿ ਸਮਾਪਤਮ ਸਤੁ ॥੧੪॥
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatake Raamavataar Atkaae Badhah Dhiaae Samaaptam Sat(u)||14||
translation: End of the Chapter entitled ‘Killing of Atkaaye’ in Ramavtar in BACHITTAR NATAK.
Now begins the description of the war with Makrachh :

gurmukhi: ਤਬ ਰੁਕਯੋ ਸੈਨ ਮਕਰਾਛ ਅਾਨ ॥ ਕਹ ਜਾਹੁ ਰਾਮ ਨਹੀ ਪੈਹੋ ਜਾਨ ॥
transliteration: Tab Roukyo Sain Makraachh Aan|| Kah Jaahu Raam Nahipaiho Jaan||
translation: After that Makrachh joined the army and said. “O Ram ! You cannot save yourself now;

gurmukhi: ਜਿਨ ਹਤਯੋ ਤਾਤ ਰਣ ਮੋ ਅਖੰਡ ॥ ਸੋ ਲਰੋ ਅਾਨ ਮੋਸੋਂ ਪ੍ਰਚੰਡ ॥੫੧੮॥
transliteration: Jin Hatyo Taat Ran Mo Akhannd|| So Daro Aan Moson Prachanndd||518||
translation: He who has killed my father, that mighty warriors should come forward and wage war with me.”518.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਮ ਸੁਣਿ ਕੁਬੈਣ ਰਾਮਾਵਤਾਰ ॥ ਗਹਿ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਅਸਤ੍ਰ ਕੋਪਯੋ ਜੁਝਾਰ ॥
transliteration: Im Soun(i) Kabain Raamaavtaar|| Gad(i) Sastra Astra Kapyo Jujhaar||
translation: Ram heard these crooked words and in great rage he held his weapons and arms in his hands;

gurmukhi: ਬਹੁ ਤਾਣ ਬਾਣ ਤਿਹ ਹਣੇ ਅੰਗ ॥ ਮਕਰਾਛ ਮਾਰਿ ਡਾਰਯੋ ਨਿਸੰਗ ॥੫੧੯॥
transliteration: Bahu Taan Baan Tih Hane An|| Makraachh Daar(i) Ddaryo Nisan||519||
translation: He pulled (his bow) discharged his arrows, and fearlessly killed Makrachh.519.

gurmukhi: ਜਬ ਹਤੇ ਬੀਰ ਅਰ ਹਣੀ ਸੈਨ ॥ ਤਬ ਭਜੌ ਸੂਰ ਹੁਅੈ ਕਰ ਨਿਚੈਨ ॥
transliteration: Jab Hate Beer Ar Hanisain|| Tab Bhajau Soor Huai Kar Nichain||
translation: When this hero and his army were killed, then all the warriors, becoming weaponsless, ran away (from the filed);

gurmukhi: ਤਬ ਕੁੰਭ ਅੌਰ ਅਨਕੁੰਭ ਅਾਨ ॥ ਦਲ ਰੁੱਕਯੋ ਰਾਮ ਕੋ ਤਯਾਗ ਕਾਨ ॥੫੨੦॥
transliteration: Tab Kounbh Aur Ankounbh Aan|| Dal Roukkyo Raam Ko Tyaag Kaan||520||
translation: After that Kumbh and Ankumbh came forward and obstructed the army of Ram.520.

gurmukhi: ਤ੍ਰੱਪੇ ਤਾਜੀ ॥ ਗੱਜੇ ਗਾਜੀ ॥ ਸੱਜੇ ਸਸਤ੍ਰੰ ॥ ਕੰਛੇ ਅਸਤ੍ਰੰ ॥੫੨੧॥
transliteration: Trappe Taajee|| Gadje Gadjee|| Sajje Sastran|| Kachchhe Astran||521||
translation: The horses jumped, the warriors thundered and began to strike blows, being bedecked with weapons and arms.521.

transliteration: Toutte Traanan|| Chhoutte Baanan|| Rouppe Bderan|| Boutthe Taaran||522||
translation: The bows broke, the arrows were discharged, the warriors became firm and the shafts were showered.522.

transliteration: Ghoumme Ghaayan|| Joumme Chaayan|| Rajje Rosan|| Tajje Hosan||523||
translation: The warriors wandered after getting wounded and their zeal grew, with fury, they began to lose their senses.523.
